examples: he accepted the little they gave him

definitions.text: limited or below average in number or quantity or magnitude or extent
(quantifier used with mass nouns) small in quantity or degree; not much or almost none or (with `a') at least some
examples: there's slight chance that it will work
there's a slight chance it will work
what a big little boy you are
our worries are lilliputian compared with those of countries that are at war
giving a police officer a free meal may be against the law, but it seems to be a picayune infraction
e.e.cummings's poetry is written all in minuscule letters

definitions.text: small in a way that arouses feelings (of tenderness or its opposite depending on the context)
examples: I'm tired of your petty little schemes
he talked little about his family
